properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 6:08AM EST until February 9 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in South Carolina...

Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro
Counties

North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County

Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties


Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties

.Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are forecast across the Upstate,
Midlands, Central Savannah River Area and central North Carolina
today through tonight. This will produce minor river flooding on
many of the area rivers over the next several days.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Stevens Creek Near Modoc
* from this evening to late Saturday night...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At  5 AM Thursday the stage was 3.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tonight and
crest around 25.6 feet tomorrow morning. The river will fall
below flood stage Saturday February 08.
* At 26.0 feet...Low lying and flood prone areas near Martin Town Road
become flooded. Residents along Stevens Creek in the Riverhills
subdivision should take precautions to protect life and property
from flooding waters.
* At 19.0 feet...Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23
bridge near Modoc becomes flooded.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
